Job Title: Maintenance II - Mfg

Location: Tyler, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
MAINTENANCE - MFG / 2nd Shift

Job Summary

Installs, troubleshoots, and repairs a variety of equipment and machinery to support manufacturing, packaging, and distribution operations. Diagnoses problems and recommends solutions.

Essential Job Functions *

Electronic TroubleshootingUses knowledge and experience to resolve complex operating problems (some examples below) in a timely manner; reports other problems to Supervisor. Typical items include repairing various electrical, vacuum, mechanical, and pneumatic systems; performing mechanical calibrations and alignments; assembling and testing motor-control devices, switch panels, transformers, generator windings, solenoids, and other machinery related equipment.Preform general and preventative maintenance multiple production systems in and around the facility.Performs mechanical calibrations and alignments during preventative maintenance on equipment.Applies related knowledge to test and/or modify operational machinery and control equipment.Accurately completes daily maintenance reports.Maintains a clean and organized work environment and conserves resources by using equipment and supplies to accomplish job results without waste.Follows safety policies and procedures; reports unsafe conditions to Supervisor. This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Employees are expected and encouraged to participate in safety and health program activities including immediately reporting hazards, immediately reporting unsafe work practices and incidents to supervisors, wearing required personal protective equipment, and participating in and supporting safety committee activities.

Education & Experience

Typical education required Associate Degree, Military, or Civilian Equivalent in Industrial Maintenance Technology.Electronic Troubleshooting

Competencies â€“ Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

Two to five years related experience.Strong mechanical aptitude and attention to detail.Good interpersonal and communication skills.Able to work with minimal supervision. Flexible able to quickly shift priorities as needed.Able to work from verbal and written instructions.

Operational Equipment

N/A

 Work Environment and Physical Demands 

 Work Environment 

 Maintenance Self-paced, 8 hr shifts. May be exposed to fumes, loud noises and extreme temperatures infrequently. Functional near, far and peripheral vision and functional hearing required. 

Physical Demands

 Maintenance Medium - Very heavy, lifting up to 150 lbs.
